DataElement.preferredName: Second Primary Malignant Neoplasm Anatomic Location Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether there was second primary malignant neoplasm at another anatomic site.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Second Primary Malignant Neoplasm Anatomic Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the location of a second primary malignant neoplasm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concomitant malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concomitant malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed with subsequent malignancy OTHER than non-melanomatous skin cancer?
